solution_01_data_basics/02_proportion/04_make_relfreq_dens_v3

video

To determine the relative frequencies, just divide each frequency by 150 (because \(n=150\)). To determine the densities, divide the relative frequencies by the width of the interval, which in this case is the same for each interval (\(55-50=5\)).

Interval Frequency Relative_frequency Density
50 to 55 3 0.0200 0.00400
55 to 60 21 0.1400 0.02800
60 to 65 25 0.1667 0.03333
65 to 70 101 0.6733 0.13470
